reviews.text: Beautiful and sadly informative about Alaska's history. Lovely displays.  As a Christ follower I especially appreciated the apology letter from the Presbyterian church

Wonderful museum. The curators know everything about the articles on display. There is super cool interactive touch screen displays that tell you all about everything in the section your'e in. There is free admission every Friday for locals. I went on a field trip with one of my kids but soon visited on my own because I thought it was that interesting.  You can learn a lot about this great state we live in.

Small and interesting museum in downtown area near the cruiseship port. Great for a two hours self-guided tour while cruise ship is in port.

There is a wonderful display of native animals at the entrance and lots of artifacts, including totem poles, boats, weapons, oil pipeline and more.  Also, there is a section that addresses the historical discrimination against native people. It is definitely worth the small entry fee.

Cruiseship passengers should make the short WALK there (10 minutes). Exit port and walk to the left on main street.
Beautiful building, we held an event here and it was fantastic.
Very I formative and great place to learn the history of Alaska. Did not ok now Japan tried to attack us through Alaska...

Since the epicenter was very close, less than 10 miles away from my house, the ferocity of this earthquake was considerable, and severe enough to cause major infrastructure damage to local roads and bridges. You've probably seen a few of these pictures on the national news.
 
The event was quite scary, by far the biggest and most frightening earthquake I've ever experienced. The entire house rumbled and shook as if a freight train was running right through the living room. Being early morning on the last day of November, it was still dark outside, and the power went out almost immediately.
Surprisingly interesting to book around with the provided self-guided tour pamplet. Be sure to check out the photos on the walls for some interesting Juneau history.
Always room for improvement !
Needs a dome in order to be taken seriously.
Nice history.  Good photos. 1/2 of the building was under construction

Neat place with historical information, opportunities for lectures and presentations and great views of the glacier. Clean bathrooms and a filtered water dispenser were much appreciated. There's also a small gift shop here. Some of the whale watching tour companies will pick you up from the parking lot here if you want to book it for right after your glacier visit, which is super convenient. The glacier is beautiful as well.

Probably the highlight of our Alaska cruise, this was a fun hike into the glacier with lots of photos along the way. I don't recommend the tours as they charge $50 per person to drive you 20 minutes. We took the local bus for $2 and it was more of an adventure.
Stephanie was a great ranger. Alot of fun on kid event days. Beautiful area and trails.

A very organized and clean visitor center. The areas surrounding it are clearly marked plus the free telescopes to appreciate the glacier are great addition! The staff was wonderful and very helpful! I liked the gift store, it had plenty of stuff! Visit soon!
Spectacular views .Its a short hike to the base of the glacier.Do carry raincoats and waterproof shoes .Catch the salmon run as well if you are patient and keep and eue out at the river.

Friendly and kind staff.  LOVED the opportunity to be able to see a live bald eagle up close and take pictures.  It's nice to know she is loved and taken care of.  The views are spectacular, but the food is expensive and just modified fast food, except for the crab.  Lovely walk through the woods on a well marked trail.  Great for all ages!  So many say it is too expensive but I don't agree.  They have to keep the tram serviced all winter when not operating and summer when up and running.  It is run on electricity.  If you plan right and take plenty of time to walk the trails, see the native film (only 20 minutes long) and truly appreciate the beauty of the mountain, it is money well spent.  There are native made gifts in the shop, some which you cannot find elsewhere.  A smart shopper will ask questions and know what you're buying.  We had a great time.

Not all lift operators are created equal; and, if only going round-trip, once, it's an expensive ride! Those two things being said, as a local, I love the tram. The views are stellar and it's a wonderful experience to see Juneau from new heights without hiking up a mountain on one's own to do so.

Most of the tramway 🚡 operators are knowledgeable, out-going, and enjoy what they do. I have yet to meet an employee working the tram that I didn't like! Be aware that the tram, as it's being docked at the top, does slow down and rock gently back and forth prior to it lodging firmly into place for your safe exit on the top of Mount Roberts. If you have a fear of heights, the rocking motion may make you uneasy; and, it's important to note, the tram does have you riding above treetops. If afraid of heights, look out and not down! The lift takes about 5 minutes to go up and 5 minutes to go back down and is made available for either direction within reasonably spaced, short intervals. Once off-loaded, at the top of Mount Roberts, take your time to enjoy the Nature Center, the Gift Shop, Grab a Bite to Eat, and find your way to Father Brown's Cross for Amazing, Awe-inspiring Views that seem like movie back-drops but are perfectly real; a place where time stands still. 

What goes up, must come down; thankfully, a tram like the one in Juneau is safe, secure, and smooth. It seems to glide as it brings you back down to earth. It's a brilliant contraption that's well maintained and kept clean. If a tourist, the expensive, round-trip ticket is worth the cost for a once in a lifetime experience like none other. If a local, the season pass would be a good thing to nab as it'll save you money and allow you to travel, by tram, as often as you'd like. 😊

What a great place! The ride to the top I would rate at 12* Highlight of my day here. Staff are very nice and shared their own insights. The view is WOW!  I'm very happy with all this offered. Lot's to see and do up here. 
Thank you for a wonderful trip. 🇨🇦😊
The views were very beautiful and breathtaking. The restaurant up there was really good too. Please try their burgers!! There are yummy!!!

This is a must if you are visiting town. Great views of downtown Juneau. They have souvenirs and food at the top. Also access to hikes and even a eagle that was rescued from a crazy hunter that shot her. I think her name is Lady Baltimore.
Very Serene and beautiful. The water the mountains The View oh my goodness just awesome.

This is an outstanding beautiful, serene place tucked away off the main road about 20 minutes outside the city. It is a lovey drive out out to St Therese. Once you pull into this lovely venue, you know you have found a place where you can enjoy yourself and your thoughts. The grounds are very well kept and the Zen or Reflection Garden is very beautiful. Guests are free to roam about the property at their leisure unfettered. It is a nice little walk over to the Shrine set apart from the main property on a small island giving an extra sense of serenity and separation. The surrounding scenery with the water and mountains in the background is breathtaking.  This could easily be described as one's "Happy Place."
BEAUTIFUL CHURCH..... the scenery is  nose too... lots of history out there.... I highly recommend this place....
A nice little gem worth the drive to see.
Welcoming group cleaning the church.   Gorgeous location for a walk with many photo opportunities.

The JACC hosts many evens from yoga to kickin dance tunes during folk fest. Always sure to pack the house, the JACC is one of few places in Juneau which offers cultural education and fun activities for both adults and children.
Always something fun going on.
The events are always phenomenally and very exciting to say the least.
New art exhibits on 1st Friday and pickleball on Mondays.

Even though we need a larger JACC building, this facility hosts great events with the given space. Always clean, and staff have always been friendly. Nancy is an extremely hard worker and it would be great if we had a larger facility for events and talent that visits town.

I enjoy shopping at IGA. Their prices are a little higher than the rest of the stores in town. IGA has a wide range of groceries that you cannot find throughout Juneau. I also like their salad bar and their Deli. Probably the best in town. Customer service and friendliness from their personnel is very good.

Living in a village where you can't buy lots of things people down south take for granted,  places like this seem like a smorgasbord.  Ooh! Cheese! What? Soda that's not $11.50 a 12 pack? Awesome! Lol

Needs to get fresh organic produce and rotate old produce. Get rid of the old product don't try to let it linger 🤷🏼‍♂️
And start marking down soon- to- be- expired- food BEFORE it is expired, please. Just a thought.
Yes I like shopping there so very good place

A lot of specialty items for a large grocery, and they know what the locals want -- things that are hard to get in Juneau like cheese imports and exotic fruit. The salad bar's good, I use it for lunch often, and the deli is exceptional -- the mole burritos & ribs are better than grocery store food has a right to be. Good seafood counter and frozen meats. Good Filipino food selection.

This is our main store for shopping close to home! It can be pretty spendy at times with prices, but with Just4U coupons help a lot!! They have some great deals at times. If you want quality and a variety even with Safeway brands  Safeway is great for that. They have a deli, bakery and pharmacy. They also have a Starbucks inside. The one complaint I have lately with them is their meat department. The quality of their meat isn't as great as it use to be. We've found bone grit on the pork and bones in boneless skinless chicken. Otherwise I love their produce, breads, desserts and products!! Plus you'll always get GREAT customer service and asked if you need help out!! Or you can also do self checkout instead.

All and all it's not a bad place to shop... it's a little spendy... you definitely need to watch for deals... The cashiers are pretty nice..The pharmacy and their employees are Rock Stars... Trevor is one of the pharmacist who always goes above and beyond to take care of your needs... Thank you ever so much Trevor... yes, Amy your pretty awesome... Thank you kindly... :-) :-) :-)

This store is brightly lit and well maintained. We usually go to Costco for a lot of reasons but for small and unique grocery purchases we end up at Safeway. The checkers at this location are almost always pleasant and attentive, both things that aren't always guaranteed these days.
Its a grocery store chain. The quality is good. The price is a little high, but they offer a membership discount.

The old lady in the deli is absolutely the rudest person I’ve ever met in my life she constantly makes you feel like your bothering her that you want a sandwhich rolled her eyes and got huffy puffy that I asked for bacon and proceeded to say “I guess, but that’s gonna cost more” (like I didn’t already know that) then didn’t ask me if I wanted anything else threw my snadwhich on the counter and walked away. I will never be going back there again so disappointed

This is one of the few Costcos that I know if with 2 floors. This makes it more cumbersome to get around the store, particularly if you forget to get something on the second floor once you've descended to the first. 
That aside, it has a great selection and occasional seasonal treasures.
Rotisserie chicken is tasty and cheap at 699 yen! Great place to buy steaks as well.

Very good whole sale kind of store. 
👍 Prices are cheap compared to other shops. Really competitive pricing.
👍 can find many items which is not available in shops around. 
👍 Many organic items are available.
👍 can find many American products here.

Negative points are:
👎🏽 you need to buy large quantities, which some times we may not require. 
👎🏽 for some of the cycles sold here, getting spare parts would be difficult.
Verry nice shopping centre and you can get all goods with reasonable price.
We love the food here, and fresh berries available all year round.

One of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had (ranks up there with the "Whole Foods Incident"). So my sister renewed my member card which is on a family plan. I trusted this would work and decided to stop by this Costco which is a huge trip out of the city, so everything had to go well or else it would be a wasted trip. Erring on the side of caution, I decided to ask the front desk about my member status anyway. Sure enough, I knew they would screw it up. They stared at the screen in confusion and after a few minutes of squabbling amongst each other, claimed my card was now invalid! I protested that it was on a family plan and had indeed been renewed, but they claimed I could not prove that and the issue was with "America". They continued to blame "America" until I shouted them down saying it's not a problem with a country, it's a COSTCO problem. That shut them up and they issued a temporary pass. The next day they called me back to tell me my card was indeed activated. So all this was COMPLETELY unnecessary and blaming a country is just plain unprofessional. 
Oh, and they won't let you buy one box of muffins. You are not even allowed to do so. You have to carry two heavy boxes or none at all, and I was carrying them home by hand. As a loyal customer of this place since I was in grade school, absolutely shameful, Costco.

This is our usual stop on a Sunday whenever we're in Atlanta when driving to Florida. The food was good, but the service was terrible! The waitress didn't know what hoisin sauce was and it took forever to even get a refill?? Dim sum off the cart is a favorite and what we always get, just wish the service had been as good as the food. So on our way back from Florida we stopped there again. And again good food with terrible service, as no one came to check on us or give us refills??
Sweet & sour chicken done right!! Loved every bite. Service was very attentive unlike most Asian restaurants.

I had a pretty bad experience overall. Granted, it is Christmas Day, and it's crowded, but I've been to many restaurants on this day with much better service. My friend sat here waiting for ten minutes without one person even addressing that she was a sitting customer. She eventually snagged the dim sum cart lady for some dumplings. We arrived right after and we sat for twenty more minutes. We had to ask for menus, and we literally got ONE menu for THREE people. We hopped on the dim sum cart bandwagon since that was the only service we were apparently going to get. When a server finally came to the table after flagging her down, she had an attitude problem as if we were bothering her. The only two good things about this place were the egg rolls and the one server who eventually apologized for the lack of service due to being shorthanded and crowded. It is obviously a popular place, but I won't be returning.

What makes this a great Chinese restaurant is the Dim Sum experience.  Besides the four pages of normal Chinese dishes, Dim Sum allows you to pick small samples from a cart that is rolled around the restaurant. The restaurant staff will describe each of the mini dishes to you. The samples are around $3-4 a piece and can be shared around the table.  So 2-3 people can share 8-10 Dim Sum dishes.  since you a charged for each Item you can stop at any time. Try a new Chinese experiance.

Pretty good dim sum on the weekends. They could do a better job of getting the carts around more efficiently and if you’re sitting in the back corner, well good luck. I constantly have to hunt a server down to get us what we want.
One of those wonderful hole in the wall treasures. Authentic Mexican food that never disappoints. Staff is friendly and the food is great.
Best Mexican food in Sonoma County!
Great el pastor. Consistently good Mexican food.

Where the locals eat. El Sombrero has been in business for over 30+ years. It is a locally family owned business and the food is great. If you want some good salsa, El Sombrero Is the place. I usually go for the tacos with tripas, chorizo, and a pastor are my favorites. Try it! I would have taken pictures but when I realized, it was too late.
Over 2 decades,where else can you get a tongue burrito ,the best.

I like it, but if you don't mind the alcohol environment, then it's a good place to visit. It's kinda like a bar,& a restaurant all in one. I haven't seen any children in there though. It's not a place i go to very often, but it has some darn good food, for a fairly good price too. So, it's an excellent place for adults to have a quiet bite to eat, or otherwise. I don't know what their policy is on whether kids are able to go into there, or not. Check it out for yourself,& see if you like it, like me. They're real nice,& (as far as i was able to tell), they're very polite too. 😁😋😍😎

Before this latest visit, I had very bad experiences. Terrible service and overpriced mediocre food. However, I was invited to lunch and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Only complaint was the server was TOO on top of things. It was kind of annoying. Every bite I took he asked if everything was good here. And the water girl filled up my glass before it was even close to empty. Still I prefer that to how it was before. Four stars

Disclaimer- this is a personal opinion. My wife loves Hangar on the Wharf, and has proclaimed my noncommittal shrug to be blasphemy. Still, every time I've gone I've had an issue of some sort. Last time I was there I was given the wrong food, and when my sandwich did show up it had a nice double coating of dressing on it (I'd ordered it dry). That said, once I scraped off the dressing the sandwich was good, I love their root beer, and the price is okay... but if they want four stars from me they'll have to make better fries.

I have had great meals here in previous years but was less than impressed with my jambalaya dish for dinner on a weeknight. I will say that it had a lot of shrimp, which was nice. The server was very friendly and attentive.
Pete is our favorite server!! Hes amazing to us and our 3 boys. Plus, I just love their dang food.

My expectations were low, simply because a location by the cruise docks means they might be able to get away with mediocrity, but that is not the case.  Very good beer and wine selection, and excellent seafood, all with a panoramic view out their windows.

Nice seafood place with lots of options. Our waitress wad awesome. We only had about 30 minutes before we had to be back on our cruise ship but they were able to accommodate us and rush our orders so we could have some king crab legs and fish and make back to our boat on time. The food was good and the prices reasonable. They are used to the cruise ship rush and seem to cope with the crowds pretty well.
Fantastic meal there our first night in Alaska. We will definitely return on our next trip.
Awesome king crab tacos. My favorite yet. Highly recommend to try if you want something different. So Good!

The twisted bread is great.  Burgers on freshly baked bread are amazing.  The mixed drinks might be the best ones in a restaurant in the Juneau area.  Our table had a veggie burger and it tastes just like a hamburger, so if you don't like the taste of meat I'd stay away from it.  

The atmosphere was lovely.  We all enjoyed being on a pier with the crowds from the cruise ships outside.  Down the pier at the food carts is an ice cream shop that serves large delicious scoops.

If you want a local experience, Tracy's is the place to go. Keep in mind that they don't take reservations and seating is open. 
You order and pay for your food before sitting down at the front of house as you walk in. They ask for your name and where you're from when you order so that they can bring your food to you when it's ready. All the utensils you need for eating your crab/food is brought to you, so all there is to do is find a spot to settle in to wait. 
The food is great and the atmosphere is fun. My personal favorite is the bisque over rice. The dinner rolls and butter are unlimited. Really can't ask for a better place.

Wow..
The legendary King Crab dishes served in very good manners..
It is a must-go hub when visiting Juneau.
Great cozy place.

I love the crab and crab cakes, they are made perfect and the workers are all king and polite. The crab is fresh and amazing, it may be frozen but they have it like that so they can keep it fresh after crab catchers bring it in.I highly recommend eating here

You haven't had Alaskan king crab until you've had Tracy's Alaskan king crab. A pretty fun joint with tasty craft root beer. But their namesake is why you should go. This isn't some tourist trap with mediocre food... No, Tracy's served up the largest, tastiest king crab I've ever (EVER!) had. Oh yeah, and their bisque and crab cakes were to die for, but took up space that should have been filled with another massive crab leg! The wait was a bit lengthy, but that just gave us a little more time to rest our feet. Too bad I didn't try Tracy's until my second visit to Juneau, but I will be back... I can't wait to go back!
Best crab bisque ever.  I ate here while working for Holland America in 2012 and I still remember how good this place was!
Awesome burritos!
The food was great! I could not finish it , but the flavors we're good and the service too
Outstanding Mexican food and great staff
Closed for good.

Not a fan. The carne asada had the consistency of carne guisada, but no flavor to speak of. The beef tacos were just simple ground beef with a some flavor, and had taco shells from Fred Meyers. Also, I'm pretty sure all of our food was microwaved...you can see the cook in the back using it. Would not go again.
Clean place acceptable food.

Reasonable prices, really great selection of beers for the area, food was tasty and filling. Wings are full, tender and juicy. Friend cauliflower was amazing; not too soft or over seasoned, just right. Friend pickles had a nice crunch and flavor though the house batter is a bit thick. I'd expect a lighter, crispy texture given the rest if the food. It was a bit thick and doughy. I have to say the wall hangings, especially the service members tribute, could use a good dusting. Shows a bit of oversight and lack of care for such a popular place. Aside from that all was great. Highly recommend for a casual night out.

The wings here are amazing. We had a couple varieties of bone-in and they are as good as wings at Buffs in Newton or any Buffalo Wild Wings. Also enjoyed my “dust cropper” salad with chicken. Fries are awesome. Burgers are average. Service is excellent. Only downside is the atmosphere- table was clean but seemed dated and dining room was dark and musty. We did not come for the atmosphere so if you are simply looking for awesome wings, I highly recommend the Hangar Pub.

Awesome pub and grill. All of the menu items are delicious. Large variety of chicken wing sauces. There is also a good variety of different drinks beers. Lots of TVs and comfortable seating all over. They have billiards and an arcade. The staff and very friendly, attentive and professional. Great casual place in a convenient location. 👍
Boneless wings are the best! Something like 20 different sauces and dips to try too. If you like beer, this is THE place to go! Staff is extra friendly and works hard to please... A+++ !

This place is the bomb! $13.50 for the DC-10 (1 Lb of bone out, with two choices for flavors) is a pretty good deal hey and the wings are DELISH!!🙌☺️😎

If you drink they have a slew of beers on tap and props with the arcade and pool tables off of the entrance🕹🎱
